content: The Act may be cited as the "Veterans Corporation Reauthorization Act of 2006" and outlines the purposes of the Corporation. The "Veterans Corporation Reauthorization Act of 2006" amends the Small Business Act to establish a national network of information and assistance centers for veterans and the public, providing access to small business programs, research, counseling, and referrals. Section 33(c)(6) of the Small Business Act is amended to set the terms for appointed members of the Board of Directors, with a 4-year term limit and restrictions on serving beyond the appointed term. The Small Business Act is amended to allow for the removal of Board Members with approval from the Board of Directors and relevant Senate Committees if they are unable to fulfill their duties. SEC. 4 amends the Small Business Act to change the timing of the transfer of advisory committee duties from October 1, 2006, to October 1, 2009. SEC. 5 authorizes appropriations. Section 33(k) of the Small Business Act is amended to increase funding for fiscal years 2007, 2008, and 2009 to $2,000,000 each year. Matching requirements are also imposed on grants to the Corporation under this section. The section requires a matching amount to be provided from sources other than the Federal Government for grants to the Corporation. There is a limitation on the total revenue of the Corporation that can be acquired from fee-for-service tools or direct charges to veterans receiving services. The Corporation in 2006 was restricted from engaging in revenue-generating activities not aligned with its mission. Unspent funds at the end of the fiscal year would return to the Treasury. PRIVATIZATION. Section 33 of the Small Business Act is amended to include a provision for the privatization of the Corporation. This involves developing a plan to raise private funds and become self-sustaining, along with a GAO audit requirement. The audit required by this paragraph evaluates the Corporation's efficacy in fulfilling its purposes and analyzes the feasibility of its sustainability plan. The Comptroller General must submit a report on this audit to specific committees within one year of the Veterans Corporation Reauthorization Act of 2006.
